job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam School of Business and Economics is seeking an all-round data scientist for 1 FTE for a period up to March 2025 in the project FIRMBACKBONE (FBB). The project team of researchers consists of Prof. dr. Wolter Hassink (UU/USE), Prof. dr. Arjen van Witteloostuijn (VU/SBE), Prof. dr. Daniel Oberski (UU/FSW), dr. Peter Gerbrands (UU/USE) and Rutger Schilpzand, MSc LLM (UU/USE)., collecting and analyzing data from companies. Such digital data is both detailed (i.e.
   deep) and long (i.e. over time) in size and it offers great potential for creating new
   economic insights and applications.

   Your duties
     * Setting up system and data security within a bigdata environment
     * Deploying the environment within the Kubernetes platform
     * Organizing and implementing efficient user access management
     * Onboarding new datasets and make them accessible for researchers
     * Extracting and supplementing metadata form available data sources
job_details.full_text:
Postdoc Data engineer FIRMBACKBONE

The Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam School of Business and Economics is seeking an all-round data scientist for 1 FTE for a period up to March 2025 in the project FIRMBACKBONE (FBB). The project team of researchers consists of Prof. dr. Wolter Hassink (UU/USE), Prof. dr. Arjen van Witteloostuijn (VU/SBE), Prof. dr. Daniel Oberski (UU/FSW), dr. Peter Gerbrands (UU/USE) and Rutger Schilpzand, MSc LLM (UU/USE)., collecting and analyzing data from companies. Such digital data is both detailed (i.e.
   deep) and long (i.e. over time) in size and it offers great potential for creating new
   economic insights and applications.

   Your duties
     * Setting up system and data security within a bigdata environment
     * Deploying the environment within the Kubernetes platform
     * Organizing and implementing efficient user access management
     * Onboarding new datasets and make them accessible for researchers
     * Extracting and supplementing metadata form available data sources

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on data engineering tasks within a research project, specifically setting up and managing a big data environment, deploying on Kubernetes, and onboarding datasets. While it involves data, it does not explicitly mention machine learning model development, generative AI, or advanced predictive modeling, which are core to ML Engineer and GenAI Engineer profiles. The role appears to be more focused on data infrastructure and accessibility for research rather than AI model creation or deployment.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Onboarding new datasets and make them accessible for researchers' directly relates to preparing and managing data for use.
job_tasks.phrase: Onboarding new datasets and make them accessible for researchers

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Extracting and supplementing metadata form available data sources' is a data preparation and enrichment task.
job_tasks.phrase: Extracting and supplementing metadata form available data sources

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Setting up system and data security within a bigdata environment' involves establishing secure operational practices for data infrastructure.
job_tasks.phrase: Setting up system and data security within a bigdata environment

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Deploying the environment within the Kubernetes platform' is a clear indicator of operational deployment and infrastructure management.
job_tasks.phrase: Deploying the environment within the Kubernetes platform

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Organizing and implementing efficient user access management' pertains to the operational control and security of the data environment.
job_tasks.phrase: Organizing and implementing efficient user access management

soft_skills.phrase: collecting and analyzing data from companies
